fields.message: We know waiting for answers can be stressful. This report summarizes what we’ve learned so far and what comes next so you can feel informed and supported.

sections.title: Your Diagnosis

fields.diagnosis_summary: Your results show early-stage breast cancer that is hormone receptor positive (ER+ / PR+) and HER2-low.

tumors.title: Tumor 1
tumors.notes: Small, localized tumor with favorable biology.

whatThisMeans.goodNews: Hormone therapy can be very effective in slowing or stopping cancer growth.
whatThisMeans.newOptions: HER2-low targeted therapies may be available if needed in the future.
whatThisMeans.treatmentFocus: The goal is to treat early and minimize recurrence risk.

sections.footer_note: This summary is based on your latest pathology and imaging reports.

items.name: MRI-Guided Biopsy
items.explanation: Tissue sample taken using magnetic resonance imaging to guide needle placement.

items.name: Oncology Consultation
items.explanation: Meet with medical oncologist to review your results and discuss your treatment plan.

sections.title: Your Likely Treatments

fields.summary: Knowing your likely treatment plan helps you prepare for your first oncology visit.
fields.disclaimer: This overview reflects current clinical guidelines and may change based on new results.

treatments.name: Endocrine Therapy (Hormone Therapy)
treatments.description: Most likely first treatment given your hormone receptor positive (ER+/PR+) status.

medications.name: Aromatase Inhibitors
medications.description: Includes letrozole, anastrozole, or exemestane — pills that lower estrogen levels.

medications.name: CDK4/6 Inhibitors
medications.description: Targeted drugs such as palbociclib, ribociclib, or abemaciclib that stop cancer cells from dividing.

side_effects.description: Hot flashes, mild joint pain, and fatigue.

treatment_time.notes: Administered orally and continued long term depending on response.

treatments.name: Targeted Therapy
treatments.description: May be considered for HER2-low cancers using antibody-drug conjugates.

medications.name: Trastuzumab deruxtecan
medications.description: Delivers chemotherapy directly to HER2-low cancer cells.

side_effects.description: Possible fatigue or mild nausea, usually fewer side effects than traditional chemo.

clinical_trials.name: NCT04812345 – HER2-low Breast Cancer Study
clinical_trials.description: Evaluating new targeted therapy for HER2-low breast cancer after endocrine treatment.

sections.disclaimer_footer: Your treatment plan may change as additional test results become available.
